definition.text: of very bad quality

meaning.translation: افتضاح

examples.text: What lousy weather!
The food was lousy.
a lousy film

definition.text: if you feel lousy, you feel ill

meaning.translation: بیمار بودن

definition.text: not very good at doing something

meaning.translation: افتضاح

examples.text: lousy at/with
I’m lousy at tennis.
Brenda’s lousy with kids.
a lousy teacher

definition.text: small, useless, or unimportant

meaning.translation: کم ، کوچک ، بی استفاده یا بی اهمیت

examples.text: He left me a lousy fifty cent tip.

definition.text:
a)a place that is lousy with people of a particular kind is too full of them
b)someone who is lousy with money has a lot more of it than they need

meaning.translation: آ) پر از گروه خاصی از آدم ها ب) زیادی پول دار

examples.text: The town was lousy with tourists.

definition.text: to take air, liquid etc into your mouth by making your lips form a small hole and using the muscles of your mouth to pull it in

meaning.translation: مکیدن ، پک زدن به سیگار

examples.text: suck something in
Michael put the cigarette to his lips and sucked in the smoke.
suck at
a baby sucking at its mother’s breast
suck something up
Jennie sucked up the last bit of milk shake with her straw.

definition.text: to hold something in your mouth and pull on it with your tongue and lips

meaning.translation: مکیدن

examples.text: Don’t suck your thumb, dear.
suck on
a picture of Lara sucking on a lollipop

definition.text: to pull someone or something with great power and force into or out of a particular place

meaning.translation: کشیدن کسی یا چیزی با فشار زیاد به داخل یا خارج جایی

examples.text: suck something into something
A bird was sucked into one of the jet’s engines.
suck somebody/something under/down
The river sucked him under.
suck something out of/from something
The fluid was sucked from his lungs.

definition.text: used when you dislike something very much or think something is very bad

meaning.translation: افتضاحه

examples.text: If you ask me, the whole thing sucks.

definition.text: to use something or do something for a short time, to find out if it works, if you like it etc
an act of sucking

meaning.translation: عمل مکیدن

definition.text: a very serious disease that is passed from one person to another during sexual activity

meaning.translation: نوعی بیماری

definition.text: to bring food or drink up from your stomach out through your mouth because you are ill

meaning.translation: بالا آوردن ، تهوع

examples.text: Georgia was bent over the basin, throwing up.

definition.text: to produce problems, ideas, results etc

examples.text: The arrangement may throw up problems in other areas.

definition.text: if a vehicle, runner etc throws up dust, water etc as they move along, they make it rise into the air
to suddenly leave your job, your home etc

meaning.translation: ترک کردن شغل ، خانه و غیره به طور ناگهانی

examples.text: I can’t just throw everything up and come and live with you.

definition.text: to build something quickly

meaning.translation: چیزی را با دقت ساختن

examples.text: new houses hastily thrown up by developers

f2n.heading: Register
f2n.explanation: In everyday English, people usually say that someone throws up, is sick, or in American English gets sick :

definition.text: to bring food or drink up from your stomach out through your mouth, because you are ill

meaning.translation: بالا آوردن ، تهوع

examples.text: He had swallowed so much sea water he wanted to vomit.
I knew I was really in trouble when I began vomiting blood.
vomit up
I vomited up most of my dinner.

definition.text: food or other substances that come up from your stomach and through your mouth when you vomit

meaning.translation: استفراغ

definition.text: an object that is thrown at someone or is fired from a gun or other weapon, such as a bullet, stone, or shell

meaning.translation: پرتابه (چیزی که به طرف کسی پرتاب شده یا از اسلحه ای شلیک شده)

definition.text: when someone vomits with a lot of force, especially because they have drunk too much alcohol – used humorously

meaning.translation: استفراغ خیلی شدید (به ویژه بخاطر خوردن الکل بیش از حد)

definition.text: if an activity or situation involves something, that thing is part of it or a result of it

meaning.translation: در بر داشتن ، شامل بودن

examples.text: What will the job involve?
I didn’t realize putting on a play involved so much work.
involve doing something
Running your own business usually involves working long hours.

definition.text: to include or affect someone or something

meaning.translation: شامل بودن ، تأثیر گذاشتن

examples.text: These changes will involve everyone on the staff.
There have been four accidents involving Forest Service planes.

definition.text: to ask or allow someone to take part in something

meaning.translation: درخواست کردن یا اجازه دادن به کسی برای مشارکت کردن در چیزی

examples.text: involve somebody in (doing) something
Try to involve as many children as possible in the game.
We want to involve the workforce at all stages of the decision-making process.

definition.text: to take part actively in a particular activity

meaning.translation: مشارکت فعال داشتن در یک فعالیت

examples.text: involve yourself in
Reilly involves himself in every aspect of his company’s business.

f2n.heading: Register
f2n.explanation: In everyday English, people usually say that someone puts forward plans, ideas etc, rather than proposes them:
examples: The idea was first put forward by a German scientist.

definition.text: to suggest something as a plan or course of action

meaning.translation: پیشنهاد دادن

examples.text: The changes were first proposed last year.
the proposed budget cuts
propose (that)
In his speech he proposed that the UN should set up an emergency centre for the environment.
propose doing something
The report also proposes expanding the airport.
propose something to somebody
He proposed a compromise to me.

definition.text: to formally suggest a course of action at a meeting and ask people to vote on it

meaning.translation: پیشنهاد دادن

examples.text: propose a motion/amendment/resolution etc
The resolution was proposed by the chairman of the International Committee.
propose somebody for something(= he suggested formally that she should be the treasurer )
Mr Leesom proposed Mrs Banks for the position of Treasurer (= he suggested formally that she should be the treasurer ) .

definition.text: to suggest an idea, method etc as an answer to a scientific question or as a better way of doing something

meaning.translation: پیشنهاد دادن

examples.text: A number of theories have been proposed to explain the phenomenon.

definition.text: to intend to do something

meaning.translation: قصد داشتن

examples.text: propose to do something
How does he propose to deal with the situation?
propose doing something
We still don’t know how the company proposes raising the money.

definition.text:
a) to ask someone to marry you, especially in a formal way
b) to ask someone to marry you

meaning.translation: درخواست ازدواج دادن

examples.text: propose to
Shaun proposed to me only six months after we met.

definition.text: to formally ask a group of people at a social event to join you in wishing someone success, happiness, etc as they raise and drink a glass of wine

examples.text: I’d like to propose a toast to the bride and groom.

definition.text: used to mean ‘of course’ when politely allowing someone to do something or agreeing with a suggestion

meaning.translation: البته

examples.text: ‘Can I bring Alan?’ ‘By all means!’

definition.text: to make an object or pattern by cutting a piece of wood or stone

meaning.translation: حک کردن

examples.text: carve something out of/from something
a statue carved from a single block of marble
carved wooden chairs

definition.text: to cut a pattern or letter on the surface of something

meaning.translation: حک کردن

examples.text: carve something on/in/into something
Someone had carved their initials on the tree.

definition.text: to cut a large piece of cooked meat into smaller pieces using a knife

meaning.translation: بریدن یک تکه گوشت بزرگ به تکه های کوچکتر با استفاده از یک چاقو

examples.text: Carve the meat into slices.
Who’s going to carve?

definition.text: to succeed in getting the job, position, life etc that you want

meaning.translation: با موفقیت بدست آوردن شغل ، جایگاه ، زندگی یا غیره که می خواهی

examples.text: He carved a niche for himself as a writer.
She carved out a successful career in the film industry.
He moved to Boston to carve out a new life for himself.

definition.text: if a river, the wind etc carves land or rock, it removes some of it

examples.text: The river had carved channels in the limestone rock.

definition.text: to reduce the size of something by removing some of it

meaning.translation: کاهش دادن اندازه یا مقدار چیزی با حذف بخشی از آن

examples.text: carve something from something
The company carved $1 million from its budget.

definition.text: a desire to do something, to have something, or to have something happen

meaning.translation: آرزو

examples.text: wish of
It’s important to listen to the wishes of the patient.
wish to do something
Despite her wish to continue working, she was forced to retire at the age of 62.

definition.text: a silent request for something to happen as if by magic

meaning.translation: آرزو

examples.text: Close your eyes and make a wish .

definition.text: if you do something against someone’s wishes, you do it even though you know they do not want you to

meaning.translation: برخلاف خواسته کسی

examples.text: She’d left school against her mother’s wishes.
go against somebody’s wishes(= do something against their wishes )

definition.text: used, especially in cards and letters, to say that you hope someone will be happy, successful, or healthy

meaning.translation: بهترین ها رو برات آرزو می کنم

examples.text: best/good/warmest etc wishes for
Best wishes for a long and happy retirement!
She asked me to pass on her good wishes to all her friends and colleagues.
(With) best wishes(= used at the end of a letter before you sign your name )
With best wishes, Celia.

definition.lexUnit: have no wish to do something
definition.text: used to emphasize that you do not want or intend to do something

meaning.translation: قصد انجام کاری را نداشتن (با تأکید)

examples.text: I have no wish to speak to her ever again.

definition.text: used humorously to say that you will do whatever someone asks you to do

f2n.heading: Register
f2n.explanation: In everyday English, people usually say want rather than wish :
examples: I want to see the manager.
You can go, if you want .

definition.text: if you wish to do something or you wish to have it done for you, you want to do it or want to have it done

meaning.translation: تمایل داشتن

examples.text: wish to do something
I wish to make a complaint.
If you wish to discuss this matter further please do not hesitate to contact me.
You may leave now, if you wish .
(just) as you wish(= used in formal situations to tell someone you will do what they want )
‘I’d like it to be ready by six.’ ‘Just as you wish, sir.’
The cook will prepare whatever you wish.

definition.text: to want something to be true although you know it is either impossible or unlikely

meaning.translation: کاش ، آرزو داشتن

examples.text: wish (that)
I wish I didn’t have to go to work today.
I wish that I could afford a new car.
He wished Emily were with him.
Sometimes I wish I had never been born.

definition.text: to say that you hope someone will have good luck, a happy life etc

meaning.translation: آرزو داشتن/کردن

examples.text: wish somebody something
We wish you a Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year!
We wish them every happiness in their new home.
He shook my hand and wished me luck .
wish somebody well(= say that you hope that good things will happen to someone )
My friends wished me well in my new job.

definition.lexUnit: I couldn’t wish for a nicer/better etc ...
definition.text: used to emphasize that you are very happy with what you have and cannot imagine anyone or anything better

meaning.translation: بهتر از این نمیشه

examples.text: I couldn’t wish for a better husband.
It’s the best birthday present I could have wished for.

definition.lexUnit: I wish (that) somebody would do something
definition.text: used to say that you find someone’s behaviour annoying and want them to change

meaning.translation: خواستن ، تمایل داشتن

examples.text: I wish you’d stop treating me like a child!

definition.text:
a) to want something to happen or to want to have something, especially when it seems unlikely or impossible
b) to silently ask for something you want and hope that it will happen by magic or good luck – used especially in children’s stories

meaning.translation: آرزو داشتن/کردن

examples.text: wish for
It was no use wishing for the impossible.
She was like the sister I never had but always wished for.
wish for
One day she found a magic ring that brought her whatever she wished for.

definition.text: used to say that something is not true, but you wish it was

meaning.translation: امیدوارم

examples.text: ‘I think he really likes you.’ ‘I wish!’

definition.text: used to tell someone that what they want to happen or be true will definitely not happen or become true

meaning.translation: به همین خیال باش

examples.text: ‘I’m going to be famous one day.’ ‘You wish!’

definition.text: used to say that something is very unpleasant and that you would not like anyone to have to experience it

meaning.translation: خدا نصیب کسی نکنه

examples.text: Having your house broken into is terrible. I wouldn’t wish it on anybody.

definition.lexUnit: I don’t wish to interfere/be nosy etc
definition.text: used to show you are sorry if what you are going to say upsets or annoys someone

meaning.translation: قصد ... ندارم ولی

examples.text: I don’t wish to seem ungrateful, but it’s not quite what I expected.

definition.text: used to emphasize that you do not know something, and you wish you did know

examples.text: ‘Where on earth have they gone?’ ‘I wish I knew!’

definition.text: a model of someone’s head, shoulders, and upper chest, usually made of stone or metal

meaning.translation: سردیس (مجسمه ای از سر ، شانه ها و بخش بالای قفسه سینه یک شخص)

examples.text: bust of
a bust of Beethoven

definition.text: a woman’s breasts, or the part of her clothes that covers her breasts
a measurement around a woman’s breast and back

examples.text: a 36-inch bust

definition.text: a situation in which the police go into a place in order to catch people doing something illegal

meaning.translation: هجوم پلیس به داخل مکانی برای بازداشت مجرمان

examples.text: a drug bust

inflections: ( past tense and past participle bust British English, busted especially American English )
title: bust_verb_1

definition.text: to break something

meaning.translation: شکستن

examples.text: I bust my watch this morning.
Tony busted the door down.

inflections: ( past tense and past participle bust British English, busted especially American English )
title: bust_verb_2

definition.text:
a) if the police bust someone, they charge them with a crime
b) if the police bust a place, they go into it to look for something illegal

meaning.translation: آ) دستگیر کردن ب) هجوم بردن پلیس به داخل مکانی برای بازرسی در مورد یک فعالیت غیر قانونی

examples.text: He was busted by US inspectors at the border.
bust somebody for something
Davis got busted for drugs .
Federal agents busted several money-exchange businesses.

inflections: ( past tense and past participle bust British English, busted especially American English )
title: bust_verb_3

definition.text: to try extremely hard to do something

meaning.translation: تلاش خیلی زیادی کردن برای انجام کاری

examples.text: I bust a gut trying to finish that work on time.

inflections: ( past tense and past participle bust British English, busted especially American English )
title: bust_verb_4

definition.text: to use too much money, so that a business etc must stop operating

meaning.translation: بیش از حد پول خرج کردن به نحوی که بعدش به مشکل برخورد کنی

examples.text: The trip to Spain will probably bust our budget.

inflections: ( past tense and past participle bust British English, busted especially American English )
title: bust_verb_5

definition.text: used with nouns to show that a situation is being ended or an activity is being stopped

examples.text: crime-busting laws

inflections: ( past tense and past participle bust British English, busted especially American English )
title: bust_verb_6

definition.text: used to say that you will try very hard to go somewhere or do something

examples.text: Idaho or bust!

inflections: ( past tense and past participle bust British English, busted especially American English )
title: bust_verb_7

definition.text: to give someone a lower military rank as a punishment

meaning.translation: تنزل رتبه دادن

definition.text: a business that goes bust cannot continue operating

meaning.translation: به مشکل خوردن و متوقف شدن (در مورد یک کسب و کار)

definition.text: broken

meaning.translation: خراب

examples.text: The television’s bust again.

definition.text: a duty to be in charge of someone or something, so that you make decisions and can be blamed if something bad happens

meaning.translation: مسئولیت

examples.text: Kelly’s promotion means more money and more responsibility.
+for
The Minister has responsibility for the National Health Service.
with responsibility for something
a manager with responsibility for over 100 staff
it is somebody’s responsibility to do something
It’s your responsibility to inform us of any changes.

definition.text: blame for something bad that has happened

meaning.translation: مسئولیت

examples.text: The firm is denying all responsibility.
responsibility for
No one wants to take responsibility for the problem.
The surgeon accepted full responsibility for the error that led to her death.
So far no one has claimed responsibility  (= said that they are responsible ) for the bombings.

definition.text: something that you must do as part of your job or duty

meaning.translation: مسئولیت

examples.text: My responsibilities include answering the phone and dealing with customer enquiries.
family/professional/parental etc responsibilities
a single parent struggling to balance work and family responsibilities

definition.text: something that you ought to do because it is morally or socially right

meaning.translation: مسئولیت ، وظیفه

examples.text: a responsibility to do something
We all have a responsibility to protect the environment.
Parents need to encourage a sense of responsibility in their children (= the ability to behave sensibly in a way that will not harm themselves or other people ) .
moral/social/legal etc responsibility
The company saw it as part of its social responsibility to provide education for its workers.

definition.text: a duty to help someone because of your work or position in society

meaning.translation: مسئولیت ، وظیفه

examples.text: A doctor’s first responsibility is to her patients.

definition.lexUnit: do something on your own responsibility
definition.text: to do something without being told to do it or officially allowed to do it

meaning.translation: انجام دادن کاری با مسئولیت خودت

definition.text: something that you have to do because it is morally or legally right

meaning.translation: وظیفه

examples.text: I promise I will do my duty .
We feel it is our duty to help her.
Local authorities have a duty to keep the streets clean.
You have a duty to your husband and to your children.
She has a strong sense of moral duty .
The unions have failed in their duty to female workers.
In the traditional Hindu family, the son is duty-bound to look after his mother.

definition.text: something you have to do as part of your job

meaning.translation: وظیفه

examples.text: duties
Martin’s duties included cleaning the cars.
She works for her father doing part-time secretarial duties.
He will soon be fit enough to carry out his duties  (= do his job ) .
He can only do light duties .
When Juliet reported for duty  (= arrived and said she was ready to start work ) she was sent to check on a new patient.
A teacher may be fired for neglect of duty  (= failing to do their job properly ) .
He did three tours of duty in Vietnam (= three periods working in a foreign country as a soldier, government officer etc ) .

definition.text: to be working or not working at a particular time, especially when you are doing a job which people take turns to do, so that someone is always doing it

meaning.translation: شیفت بودن/نبودن

examples.text: He’s on night duty.
Mary goes on duty(= starts working ) tonight at half past ten.
What time do you go off duty( = finish work )?

definition.text: a tax you pay on something you buy

meaning.translation: نوعی مالیات بر کالا یا خدمات

examples.text: duty on
the duty on cigarettes
customs duty(= tax paid on goods coming into the country )

definition.text: to be used as something

meaning.translation: به عنوان چیزی استفاده شدن

examples.text: The living room also does duty as a home office.

definition.text: an injury caused by fire, heat, the light of the sun, or acid

meaning.translation: سوختگی (بدن)

examples.text: His body was covered in cigarette burns.
severe/serious burns
She was taken to the hospital with serious burns.
Several of the survivors suffered severe burns.
She is being treated for minor burns.

definition.text: a mark on something caused by fire or heat

meaning.translation: سوختگی

examples.text: The desk was covered with graffiti and burn marks .

definition.text: a painful mark on the skin caused by it rubbing hard against something rough
a painful hot feeling in your muscles when you exercise a lot

meaning.translation: یک احساس دردناک سوختگی در ماهیچه ها بعد از ورزش زیاد

examples.text: Go for the burn.

definition.text: a small stream

meaning.translation: یک جویبار کوچک

inflections: ( past tense and past participle burnt / bɜːnt $ bɜːrnt / or burned )
title: burn_verb_1

definition.text:
a) if a fire burns, it produces heat and flames
b) if something is burning, it is producing flames and being damaged or destroyed by fire

meaning.translation: سوختن

examples.text: There was a fire burning in the fireplace.
An average household candle will burn for about six hours.
Parts of the building are still burning.

inflections: ( past tense and past participle burnt / bɜːnt $ bɜːrnt / or burned )
title: burn_verb_2

definition.text: to destroy or damage something with fire

meaning.translation: سوزاندن ، سوختن

examples.text: I burnt all his old letters.
Cars were burned and shops were looted during the rioting.
The Grand Hotel had burnt to the ground .
Make sure the iron isn’t too hot or you’ll burn the cloth.
He dropped his cigarette and burnt a hole in the carpet.

inflections: ( past tense and past participle burnt / bɜːnt $ bɜːrnt / or burned )
title: burn_verb_3

definition.text: to hurt yourself or someone else with fire or something hot

meaning.translation: سوزاندن ، سوختن

examples.text: I burned my hand on the oven door.
She was badly burned in a road accident.
Sixteen passengers were burned to death (= died in a fire ) .
A family of five were burned alive in their home last night (= died in a fire ) .
Heretics were burnt at the stake (= burnt in a fire as a punishment ) .

inflections: ( past tense and past participle burnt / bɜːnt $ bɜːrnt / or burned )
title: burn_verb_4

definition.text: if the sun burns your skin, or if your skin burns, it becomes red and painful from the heat of the sun

meaning.translation: دچار آفتاب سوختگی کردن/شدن

examples.text: I burn quite easily.
Don’t forget you can still get burnt when you’re swimming or when it’s cloudy.
Her face and neck were quite badly burned .

inflections: ( past tense and past participle burnt / bɜːnt $ bɜːrnt / or burned )
title: burn_verb_5

definition.text: to spoil food by cooking it for too long, or to become spoiled in this way

meaning.translation: سوختن (غذا)

examples.text: I’m afraid I’ve burnt the pizza.
burn something to a crisp/cinder
The meat was burned to a crisp.

inflections: ( past tense and past participle burnt / bɜːnt $ bɜːrnt / or burned )
title: burn_verb_6

definition.text: to damage or destroy something by a chemical action

meaning.translation: سوختن

examples.text: Quite a lot of household chemicals can burn your skin.

inflections: ( past tense and past participle burnt / bɜːnt $ bɜːrnt / or burned )
title: burn_verb_7

definition.text: if you burn a fuel, or if it burns, it is used to produce power, heat, light etc

meaning.translation: سوزاندن ، سوختن

examples.text: The boiler burns oil to produce heat.
greenhouse gases caused by the burning of fossil fuels

inflections: ( past tense and past participle burnt / bɜːnt $ bɜːrnt / or burned )
title: burn_verb_8

definition.text: if you burn fat or calories, you use up energy stored in your body by being physically active

meaning.translation: سوزاندن ، سوختن

examples.text: Taking a brisk walk every morning is a great way to burn calories.
a fat-burning exercise

inflections: ( past tense and past participle burnt / bɜːnt $ bɜːrnt / or burned )
title: burn_verb_9

definition.text: if a light or lamp burns, it shines or produces light

meaning.translation: درخشیدن ، نورافشانی کردن

examples.text: A lamp was burning in the kitchen window.
The hall light was still burning.

inflections: ( past tense and past participle burnt / bɜːnt $ bɜːrnt / or burned )
title: burn_verb_10

definition.text: if a part of your body burns, or if something burns it, it feels unpleasantly hot

meaning.translation: سوختن

examples.text: The whisky burned my throat as it went down.
My eyes were burning from the smoke.

inflections: ( past tense and past participle burnt / bɜːnt $ bɜːrnt / or burned )
title: burn_verb_11

definition.text: if your face or cheeks are burning, they feel hot because you are embarrassed or upset

examples.text: I could feel my cheeks burning as I spoke.

inflections: ( past tense and past participle burnt / bɜːnt $ bɜːrnt / or burned )
title: burn_verb_12

definition.text: if you burn a CD or DVD, you record music, images, or other information onto it using special computer equipment

meaning.translation: رایت کردن ( به معنی : ثبت و ضبط اطلاعات) روی یک سی دی یا دی وی دی

inflections: ( past tense and past participle burnt / bɜːnt $ bɜːrnt / or burned )
title: burn_verb_13

definition.text: to feel a particular emotion very strongly

meaning.translation: یک احساس خاص (مثل خشم ، میل ، کنجکاوی و غیره) را خیلی قوی حس کردن

examples.text: She was burning with curiosity.

inflections: ( past tense and past participle burnt / bɜːnt $ bɜːrnt / or burned )
title: burn_verb_14

definition.text: to want to do or find out something very much

examples.text: Want to hear a juicy bit of news?

definition.text: involving work that is enjoyable and satisfying

meaning.translation: شامل کاری که خیلی لذت بخش و رضایت بخش است

examples.text: She’s been trying to get a really juicy role for years.

definition.text: involving a lot of money

meaning.translation: شامل خیلی پول

examples.text: a big juicy cheque

definition.text: the liquid that comes from fruit and vegetables, or a drink that is made from this

meaning.translation: آب میوه یا سبزیجات یا نوشیدنی ای که از اینها درست میشه

examples.text: the liquid that comes from fruit and vegetables, or a drink that is made from this
a carton of orange juice

definition.text: the liquid that comes out of meat when it is cooked

meaning.translation: آب گوشت

definition.text: the liquid inside your stomach that helps you to digest food

meaning.translation: مایع درون معده که به هضم غذا کمک می کند

definition.text: something that produces power, such as petrol or electricity

meaning.translation: چیزی که نیرو تولید می کنه مثل بنزین یا برق

examples.text: Okay, turn on the juice.

definition.text: to get the juice out of fruit or vegetables

meaning.translation: گرفتن آب میوه یا سبزیجات

definition.text: a small specially shaped piece of metal that you put into a lock and turn in order to lock or unlock a door, start a car etc

meaning.translation: کلید

examples.text: A bunch of keys hung from his belt.

definition.text: the part of a plan, action etc that will make it possible for it to succeed

meaning.translation: کلید

examples.text: the key to
Working well as a team is the key to success.
a discovery that may hold the key to our understanding of the universe

definition.text: the buttons that you press on a computer keyboard to operate the computer

meaning.translation: کلیدی در کیبورد کامپیوتر

examples.text: Press the ‘Escape’ key to exit.
hot key/shortcut key(= a special key on a computer, that does specific things )

definition.text:
a) the wooden or metal parts that you press on a piano and some wind instruments in order to play them
b) a scale of notes that begins with one particular note, or the quality of sound this scale has

meaning.translation: آ) کلید پیانو یا بعضی سازهای بادی

examples.text: piano keys
a tune in the key of A minor

definition.text: a list of the signs, colours etc used on a map or technical drawing etc that explains what they mean
the printed answers to a test or set of questions in a book

meaning.translation: کلید سؤالات

definition.text: a small flat island, especially one that is part of a group near the coast

meaning.translation: یک جزیره کوچک و هموار

examples.text: the Florida Keys

definition.text: if you key a win for your team, you help it win a game because you play very well

examples.text: Abdul keyed the game with three touchdowns.

definition.text: to prepare a surface so that a covering such as paint will stick to it
very important or necessary

meaning.translation: کلیدی ، خیلی مهم و ضروری

examples.text: China’s support is key to the success of the coalition.
key factor/points/questions etc
The president makes all the key decisions on foreign policy.
key role/player/figure etc(= one with a lot of influence on a result )
The show has been hit by the departure of key personnel.

definition.text: used to show that a negative statement is also true about another thing or person, or to add a different negative statement about something or someone

meaning.translation: هم چنین

examples.text: I haven’t seen the movie and my brother hasn’t either (= he also has not seen it ) .
‘I can’t swim.’ ‘I can’t either.’
It’s not an easy car to drive, and at $40,000 it’s not cheap either.

definition.text: used to say that a negative statement is also true about you

meaning.translation: منم همینطور

examples.text: ‘I don’t have any money right now.’ ‘Me either.’

definition.text: one or the other of two things or people

meaning.translation: هر کدام

examples.text: There’s tea or coffee – you can have either.
We can offer a comfortable home to a young person of either sex.
either of
Could either of you lend me five pounds?

definition.text: used to show that a negative statement is true about both of two things or people

meaning.translation: هر دو

examples.text: I’ve lived in New York and Chicago, but don’t like either city very much.
either of
There were two witnesses but I wouldn’t trust either of them.

definition.text: both sides, ends, hands etc

meaning.translation: هر دو ، هر ، هر کدام

examples.text: He sat in the back of the car with a policeman on either side.
There are shops at either end of the street.

definition.text:
a)used to say that something will be the same whichever of two things happens or is true
b)more or less than a certain amount or measurement
c)used to say that someone or something does not firmly support or want either one of two things

meaning.translation: آ) به هر نحو ب) بیشتر یا کمتر از یک مقدار مشخص ، بالاتر یا پایین تر از یک مقدار مشخص

examples.text: You can get to Edinburgh by train or plane, but either way it’s very expensive.
A few marks either way can make the difference between a pass and a fail.
‘All right, let’s do that,’ said Camille, who didn’t care either way.

definition.text: if a situation could go either way, both possible results are equally likely

meaning.translation: هر دو نتیجه احتمالی یک موقعیت شانس برابر داشتن

examples.text: The latest opinion poll suggests the vote could go either way.

definition.text:
a)used to begin a list of two or more possibilities
b)used to say that if one thing does not happen then something else will have to
c)a situation in which you cannot avoid having to make a decision or choice

meaning.translation: یا این یا اون

examples.text: You add either one or two cloves of garlic.
She’s the kind of person you either love or hate.
It’s your choice! Either she leaves or I will!
£75 seems a lot to pay for a starter motor, but it’s either that or a new car!

definition.text: food that is crispy is pleasantly hard on the outside

meaning.translation: ترد

examples.text: a piece of crispy fried bread

f2n.heading: Register
f2n.explanation: Stupid is very frequent in spoken English, but in written English people usually prefer to use more a formal alternative, such as foolish or unwise, which sounds more polite.

definition.text: showing a lack of good sense or good judgment

meaning.translation: احمق

examples.text: stupid mistakes
That was a stupid thing to say.
I can’t believe Kate was stupid enough to get involved in this.
stupid idea/question
Whose stupid idea was this?
It was stupid of me to lose my temper.

definition.text: having a low level of intelligence, so that you have difficulty learning or understanding things

meaning.translation: احمق

examples.text: He understands – he’s not stupid.
I couldn’t do it, and it made me feel stupid.

definition.text: used when you are talking about something or someone that makes you annoyed or impatient

meaning.translation: برای وقتی استفاده میشه که داری در مورد چیزی یا کسی صحبت می کنی که تو رو آزرده خاطر می کنه یا صبرت رو لبریز کرده

examples.text: I can’t get this stupid radio to work.
What is that stupid idiot doing?

definition.text: unable to think clearly because you are extremely cold, tired etc

meaning.translation: ناتوان از درست فکر کردن بخاطر اینکه خیلی سردته ، خسته ای ، شوک شدی و غیره

definition.text: the dark shape that someone or something makes on a surface when they are between that surface and the light

meaning.translation: سایه

examples.text: the long dark shadow of an old oak tree
in the shadow of something(= along the wall, where its shadow would fall )
It was hot, and we decided to walk in the shadow of the wall (= along the wall, where its shadow would fall ) .

definition.text: darkness caused by something preventing light from reaching a place

meaning.translation: سایه

examples.text: in shadow
The room was half in shadow.
in the shadows
In the shadows, something moved.

definition.text: the bad effect or influence that something has, which makes other things seem less enjoyable, attractive, or impressive

meaning.translation: سایه (به معنی: تأثیر بد چیزی روی سایر چیزها که باعث میشه اونها کمتر لذت بخش ، جذاب یا تأثیرگذار باشند)

examples.text: in/under the shadow of something
For years, people had been living under the shadow of communism.
cast a shadow over/on something(= make something seem less enjoyable, attractive, or impressive )
The events of September 11th cast a shadow over the celebrations.

definition.lexUnit: without/beyond a shadow of a doubt
definition.text: used to say that something is definitely true

meaning.translation: بدون تردید

examples.text: Without a shadow of a doubt, he’s the most talented player we have.

definition.text: if you are in someone’s shadow, they are much more famous and successful than you are

examples.text: Kate grew up in the shadow of her film star sister.

definition.lexUnit: be a shadow of your former self
definition.text: to be weaker, less powerful, or worse than you were before

meaning.translation: ضعیف تر شدن ، قدرت کمتری داشتن یا وضعیت بدتری داشتن نسبت به قبل

examples.text: Lennox seemed like a shadow of his former self.

definition.text: small dark areas under your eyes that you have when you are very tired

meaning.translation: سایه های زیر چشم ها(به معنی: ناحیه های تاریک زیر چشم ها بخاطر خستگی)

examples.text: She looked pale, with deep shadows under her eyes.

definition.text: someone who follows someone else everywhere they go

meaning.translation: کسی که شخص دیگری رو ، هر جا که بره ، دنبال می کنه

definition.lexUnit: afraid/frightened/scared etc of your own shadow
definition.text: easily frightened or very nervous

meaning.translation: از سایه خودش هم می ترسه (به معنی: خیلی راحت می ترسه یا مضطرب میشه)

definition.text: to follow someone closely in order to watch what they are doing

meaning.translation: دنبال کردن کسی برای اینکه کارهای اون رو زیر نظر داشته باشی

examples.text: Detectives shadowed him for weeks.

definition.text: to cover something with a shadow, or make it dark

meaning.translation: سایه انداختن بر چیزی یا تاریک کردن آن

examples.text: a narrow street which was shadowed by a huge Catholic church

definition.text: the politician in the main opposition party in the British parliament who would become chancellor etc if their party was in government, and who is responsible for speaking on the same subjects

a) the most important politicians in the opposition party in the British Parliament . Each member of the Shadow Cabinet is responsible for his/her party's policy in one of the main areas of government, and is called, for example, the Shadow Minister of Defence or the Shadow Chancellor. But the Shadow Cabinet has no actual power. b) the group of politicians in the British parliament who would become ministers if their party was in government
something you hope to achieve by doing something

meaning.translation: هدف

examples.text: aim of
The aim of the research is to find new food sources.
The main aim of the course is to improve your writing.
with the aim of doing something
a campaign with the aim of helping victims of crime
Teamwork is required in order to achieve these aims .
a policy which sets out the school’s aims and objectives

definition.text: to point a gun or weapon at someone or something you want to shoot

meaning.translation: هدف قراردادن ، نشانه رفتن

examples.text: take aim at
Alan took aim at the target.

definition.text: to criticize someone or something

meaning.translation: هدف قرار دادن کسی/چیزی (به معنی: انتفاد کردن)

examples.text: Critics took aim at the president.

definition.text: someone’s ability to hit what they are aiming at when they throw or shoot something

meaning.translation: توانایی هدف گیری

examples.text: Val’s aim was very good.

definition.text: to try or intend to achieve something

meaning.translation: هدف داشتن ، تلاش کردن یا قصد داشتن برای بدست آوردن چیزی

examples.text: aim to do something
We aim to finish by Friday.
be aimed at doing something
an initiative aimed at reducing road accidents
aim for something
We’re aiming for a big improvement.

definition.text: to say or do something that is intended for a particular person or group of people

meaning.translation: هدف قرار دادن ، گفتن چیزی یا انجام دادن کاری به قصد یک شخص یا گروه خاص

examples.text: The anti-smoking campaign is aimed at teenagers.
The criticism wasn’t aimed at you.
He aimed his attacks at his opponent, calling him a "political dinosaur."

definition.text: to choose the place, person etc that you want to hit or reach and point a weapon or another object towards them

meaning.translation: هدف گرفتن

examples.text: Denver aimed his gun but did not shoot.
aim at/for
The pilot was aiming for the runway but came down in a nearby field.

definition.text: to hit or knock against something

meaning.translation: ضربه زدن ، کوبیدن یا برخورد کردن به چیزی

examples.text: bump against
I ran after him, bumping against people in my hurry.
bump into
Tim was a clumsy boy, always bumping into the furniture.
bump something on something
She bumped her arm on the table.
The roof was so low he bumped his head (= his head hit the roof ).

definition.text: to move up and down as you move forward, especially in a vehicle

meaning.translation: بالا و پایین رفتن حین حرکت رو به جلو (به ویژه در یک وسیله نقلیه)

examples.text: A police car bumped down the track.
bump along
The plane was bumping along the runway.

definition.text: to push or pull something somewhere in an irregular or unsteady way

meaning.translation: هل دادن یا کشیدن چیزی به سمت جایی به صورت آشفته و در هم و بر هم

examples.text: Flora was bumping her bags down the steps.

definition.text: to move someone or something into a different class or group, or to remove them from a class or group altogether

meaning.translation: انتقال دادن کسی یا چیزی به یک گروه دیگر یا خارج کردن اون از یک گروه

examples.text: The flight was overbooked, and Dad was the first one to be bumped.
bump somebody up to/out of/from etc something
The reforms bumped many families off the state-provided health care list.

definition.text: to move a radio or television programme to a different time

meaning.translation: جا به جا کردن زمان یک برنامه رادیویی یا تلویزیونی به زمان دیگر

examples.text: ‘Married with Children’ will be bumped from Sundays to Saturdays.

definition.text: an area of skin that is raised because you have hit it on something

meaning.translation: ورم

examples.text: She has a bump on the back of her head.
He had a few injuries, mostly bumps and bruises.

definition.text: a small raised area on a surface

meaning.translation: یک برآمدگی کوچک بر یک سطح

examples.text: The car hit a bump on the road.

definition.text: the sound or sudden movement of something hitting a hard surface

meaning.translation: صدا یا تکان ناگهانی چیزی که به یک سطح سخت برخورد می کنه

examples.text: We heard a bump in the next room.
fall/sit down etc with a bump
Rose fell, landing with a bump.

definition.text: a small accident in which your car hits something but you are not hurt

meaning.translation: یک تصادف جزئی که در اون خودرو شخص به چیزی برخورد می کنه ولی شخص آسیبی نمی بینه

definition.text: relating to sound and the way people hear things

meaning.translation: مربوط به صدا یا شنیداری انسان ها

definition.text: an acoustic guitar or other musical instrument does not have its sound made louder electronically

meaning.translation: ساز موسیقی آکوستیک (به معنی: سازی که صدای آن توسط دستگاهی الکترونیکی تقویت نمیشه)

definition.text: an inflatable object has to be filled with air before you can use it

meaning.translation: بادی (به معنی: وسیله ای که نیازه با هوا پر بشه تا بشه ازش استفاده کرد)

examples.text: an inflatable mattress

definition.text: an object that has to be filled with air before you can use it, especially a boat or toy

meaning.translation: یک وسیله بادی (به معنی: وسیله ای که نیازه با هوا پر بشه تا بشه ازش استفاده کرد)

definition.text: if a criminal or dangerous animal is on the loose, they have escaped from prison or from their cage

meaning.translation: از زندان فرار کرده بودن یک مجرم ، از قفس فرار کرده بودن یک حیوان خطرناک

definition.text: to make something unpleasant begin

meaning.translation: شروع کردن چیزی ناخوشایند

examples.text: And now the anger Maggie had feared was loosed.

definition.text: to make something loose or to untie someone or something, especially an animal

meaning.translation: شل کردن چیزی ، باز کردن کسی یا چیزی که با بند بسته شده (به ویژه یک حیوان)

definition.text: to fire an arrow, a bullet from a gun etc

meaning.translation: شلیک کردن تیر از یک کمان ، گلوله از یک تفنگ و غیره

definition.text: not firmly fastened in place

meaning.translation: شل ، لق

examples.text: a loose floorboard
This tooth feels very loose.
The screw has come loose  (= became loose ).

definition.text: not attached to anything else

meaning.translation: شل ، ول

examples.text: loose papers
His rear wheel spun on the loose stones.
The potatoes are sold loose (= not packed in a container ).
The driver had forgotten to fasten the safety chain and the trailer came loose  (= became unattached ).

definition.text: not tied or fastened very tightly

meaning.translation: شل

examples.text: a loose knot

definition.text: if your hair is loose, it hangs freely rather than being tied back

meaning.translation: موی رها ، موی باز

examples.text: Her hair fell loose around her shoulders.

definition.text: loose clothes are big and do not fit your body tightly

meaning.translation: گشاد

examples.text: a loose sweatshirt

definition.text: free from being controlled or held in a cage, prison, or institution

meaning.translation: رها شده از یک قفس ، زندان و غیره

examples.text: break/get loose(= escape )
A 34-year-old inmate broke loose from the sheriff’s office yesterday.
turn/let/set something loose(= let something go free )
Don’t let your dog loose on the beach.

definition.text: not exact or thoroughly done

meaning.translation: تقریبی ، نیمه تمام ، ناقص

examples.text: a loose translation
a loose interpretation of the law

definition.text: not strictly controlled or organized

meaning.translation: شل و ول ، سفت و سخت کنترل نشده یا سازماندهی نشده

examples.text: loose federation/alliance/group etc
a loose federation of political groups
loose arrangement (= an arrangement that can easily be changed )

definition.text: not pressed tightly together in a solid mass

examples.text: loose soil/earth

definition.text: not under the control of either team in a game of football, rugby etc

meaning.translation: توپ رها در زمین (به معنی: حالتی که توپ در اختیار هیچ یک از دو تیم نباشه)

examples.text: Sheringham was the first player to reach the loose ball.

definition.text:
a)to free yourself from someone or something, or their influence
b)to start enjoying yourself in a happy noisy way after a period of controlled behaviour

meaning.translation: آ) رها کردن خود از کسی یا چیزی یا تأثیر آنها ب) شروع به لذت بردن به حالتی سرخوشانه و پر سر و صدا بعد از مدتی که رفتار کنترل شده ای از خود نشان داده ای

examples.text: cut yourself loose (from something)
He cut himself loose from the constraints of family life.
I’m ready to cut loose and enjoy the weekend.

definition.text: to speak or behave in an uncontrolled way

meaning.translation: صحبت کردن یا رفتار کردن به صورتی کنترل نشده (بدون توجه و کنترل  اینکه آیا صحبت یا رفتار من مناسب است یا نه)

examples.text: She let loose a string of four-letter words.

definition.text: to allow someone to deal with something in the way they want to, when you think they will make mistakes or do something wrong

meaning.translation: اجازه دادن به کسی برای اینکه به هر نحوی که می خواد کاری رو انجام بده در حالی که فکر می کنی اون شخص اشتباه خواهد کرد و کاری را غلط انجام خواهد داد

examples.text: Whatever you do, don’t let Derek loose on the garden.

definition.text: to have nothing to do

meaning.translation: بیکار بودن ، هیچ کاری برای انجام دادن نداشتن

examples.text: I was at a loose end so I decided to go see an old movie.

definition.text: parts of something that have not been completed or correctly done

meaning.translation: بخش هایی از کاری که هنوز به طور کامل یا درست انجام نشده اند

examples.text: We’ve nearly finished, but there are still a few loose ends to be tied up  (= dealt with or completed ).

definition.text: coins that you have in your bag or pocket

meaning.translation: سکه هایی که در کیف یا جیب داری

definition.text: someone who cannot be trusted because they say or do things you do not want them to
used to tell someone to stay calm, or not to worry about something

meaning.translation: آرام بودن ، نگران نبودن

definition.text: having a problem in which the waste from your bowels has too much liquid in it

meaning.translation: اسهالی

examples.text: loose bowels

definition.text: behaving in a way that is considered to be sexually immoral

examples.text: a loose woman
loose morals

definition.text: not careful about what you say or who is listening

examples.text: There’s been a bit of loose talk about it.

definition.text: the particular combination of qualities that makes someone a particular type of person

meaning.translation: شخصیت

examples.text: He has a cheerful but quiet character.
Children grow up with a mixture of character traits (= character qualities ) from both sides of their family.
his temper and other character flaws (= bad qualities )
in character/out of character(= typical or untypical of someone’s character )
He swore, which was out of character for him.
the English/French etc character
Openness is at the heart of the American character.
character sketch(= a description of someone’s character )

definition.text:
a) a person in a book, play, film etc
b) a person of a particular type, especially a strange or dishonest one
c) an interesting and unusual person

meaning.translation: آ) یک شخصیت در یک کتاب ، نمایش ، فیلم و غیره ب) یک شخص خاص به ویژه عجیب یا فریبکار ج) یک شخص جالب و غیرعادی

examples.text: Candida is the most interesting character in the play.
In the story, the main character has left his girlfriend and baby.
Everyone recognizes Disney’s cartoon characters.
a couple of shady characters standing on the corner
I’m considered a reformed character these days (= someone who has stopped doing bad things ).
Linda was something of a character.

definition.text: the particular combination of features and qualities that makes a thing or place different from all others

meaning.translation: ذات ، طبیعت

examples.text: character of
The whole character of the school has changed.
the unspoilt character of the coast
in character
The southern state became more nationalist in character.

definition.text: a combination of qualities such as courage, loyalty, and honesty that are admired and regarded as valuable

meaning.translation: شخصیت

examples.text: a woman of great character
Schools were created to teach reading and mathematics, not moral character.
It takes strength of character to admit you are wrong.
Sport can be character building (= develop good moral qualities ).

definition.text: a quality that makes someone or something special and interesting

meaning.translation: یک ویژگی که کسی یا چیزی را خاص و جالب می کند

examples.text: a red wine with a meaty character
suburban houses that lack character

definition.text: the opinion that people have about whether you are a good person and can be trusted

meaning.translation: عقیده ای که مردم در مورد این موضوع دارند که آیا انسان خوبی هستی و میشه بهت اعتماد کرد یا نه

examples.text: a man of previous good character
The campaign was accused of character assassination (= an unfair attack on someone’s character ) because of its negative ads.
His defence called several people as character witnesses (= people who think that someone has a good character ) .
Mr Wetherby wrote him a character reference (= a statement about his good qualities ).

definition.text: a letter, mark, or sign used in writing, printing, or on a computer

meaning.translation: حرف یا علامتی در نوشته ها ، متون چاپ شده یا در یک کامپیوتر

examples.text: the Chinese character for ‘horse’

definition.text: a short film that is made by photographing a series of drawings

meaning.translation: کارتون

examples.text: cartoon characters such as Donald Duck

definition.text: a funny drawing in a newspaper or magazine, especially about politicians or events in the news

meaning.translation: کارتون (یک نقاشی بامزه در یک روزنامه یا مجله به ویژه در مورد سیاستمداران یا رویدادهایی در اخبار)

definition.text: a set of drawings that tell a funny story, especially in a newspaper or magazine

meaning.translation: مجموعه ای از نقاشی هایی که یک داستان بامزه را بیان می کنند (به ویژه در یک روزنامه یا مجله)

definition.text: a drawing that an artist does before starting to do a painting

f2n.heading: Register
f2n.explanation: In everyday English, when talking about how far something is, people often use an expression such as how far or a long/short way rather than the noun distance :
examples: How far is it from Chicago to Detroit?
The cottage is a long way from the road.

definition.text: the amount of space between two places or things

meaning.translation: فاصله

examples.text: distance from/between
the distance from Chicago to Detroit
Measure the distance between the two points.
The cottage is some distance (= quite a long distance ) from the road.
at a distance of 2 feet/10 metres etc
A shark can smell blood at a distance of half a kilometer.

definition.text: used to talk about a situation when something is far away from you in space or time

meaning.translation: دوردست (به معنی: فاصله مکانی یا زمانی چیزی از شخص زیاد باشه)

examples.text: in the distance(= they were far away )
Church bells rang in the distance (= they were far away ).
at/from a distance
We watched from a distance.

definition.text: a situation in which two people do not have a close friendly relationship

meaning.translation: فاصله (به معنی: نداشتن یک رابطه نزدیک و صمیمی)

examples.text: distance between
There was still a distance between me and my father.

definition.text:
a)to stay far enough away from someone or something to be safe
b)to avoid becoming too friendly with someone

meaning.translation: فاصله خود را حفظ کردن ( به معنی: آ) به اندازه کافی دور ایستادن از کسی یا چیزی تا در امان باشی ب) پرهیز کردن از زیادی صمیمی شدن با کسی)

examples.text: A lighthouse on the cliff warns ships to keep their distance.
The neighbours tend to keep their distance.

definition.text: to finish something you have started

meaning.translation: تمام کردن کاری که شروع کرده ای

examples.text: Do you think Greg will go the distance this time?

meaning.translation: گفتن اینکه با کسی یا چیزی ارتباط نداری

examples.text: The UNO has firmly distanced itself from the anti-government movement.

f2n.heading: Register
f2n.explanation: In everyday English, people often say they would rather do something instead of using prefer :

definition.text: to like someone or something more than someone or something else, so that you would choose it if you could

meaning.translation: ترجیح دادن

examples.text: This type of owl prefers a desert habitat.
She prefers her coffee black.
the government’s preferred option
prefer somebody/something to somebody/something
a child that prefers his imaginary world to reality
Employees said they would prefer more flexible working hours.
prefer to do something
I prefer to wear clothes made of natural fibers.
Or, if you prefer, you can email us.
prefer doing something
Chantal prefers travelling by train.
prefer that
We prefer that our teachers have a degree in early childhood education.

definition.text:
a)used to say that you wish a situation was different
b)used when telling someone politely not to do something

meaning.translation: آ) ترجیح میدم که ب) لطفاً فلان کار را انجام ندهید

examples.text: Sales have gone down, and obviously we’d prefer it if that didn’t happen.
I’d prefer it if you didn’t smoke in front of the children.

definition.text: to make an official statement that someone has done something illegal

meaning.translation: یک بیانیه رسمی تنظیم کردن در مورد اینکه شخصی مرتکب کاری غیر قانونی شده

definition.text: laughter, fun, and enjoyment

meaning.translation: خنده ، شادی و لذت

examples.text: Her eyes sparkled with merriment.
the sounds of merriment

f2n.heading: Register
f2n.explanation: In everyday English, people also often use the phrase get on someone's nerves :
examples: She got on his nerves with her stupid questions.

definition.text: to make someone feel slightly angry and unhappy about something

meaning.translation: آزردن ، آزرده خاطر کردن

examples.text: What annoyed him most was that he had received no apology.
She annoyed him with her stupid questions.
it annoys somebody when/how/that
It really annoys me when I see people dropping litter.

definition.text: a tropical climbing plant grown for its root, which is eaten as a vegetable

meaning.translation: یک گیاه گرمسیری که آن را بخاطر ریشه اش پرورش می دهند و به عنوان سبزیجات خورده می شود

definition.text: a type of sweet potato

meaning.translation: نوعی سیب زمینی شیرین

definition.text: to think about a problem, plan etc for a long time before making a decision

meaning.translation: درباره چیزی خوب فکر کردن

examples.text: He’s mulling over the proposals before making any changes.
The company is mulling over a share offer.

definition.text: an area of land that sticks out into the sea – used in Scotland

examples.text: the Mull of Kintyre

definition.text: an alcoholic drink made from apples, or a glass of this drink

meaning.translation: نوعی نوشیدنی الکلی گرفته شده از سیب یا یک لیوان از این نوشیدنی

definition.text: a non-alcoholic drink made from apples

meaning.translation: نوعی نوشیدنی غیر الکلی درست شده از سیب

definition.text: a flower or the flowers on a tree or bush

meaning.translation: غنچه ، شکوفه

examples.text: pale pink blossoms
The cherry tree was covered in blossom.

definition.text: with the flowers fully open

meaning.translation: با غنچه های کاملاً باز شده

definition.text: if trees blossom, they produce flowers

meaning.translation: غنچه دادن ، شکوفه زدن

examples.text: The apple trees are just beginning to blossom.

definition.text: to become happier, more beautiful, more successful etc

meaning.translation: شکوفا شدن (به معنی: شادتر ، زیباتر ، موفق تر و غیره شدن)

examples.text: Pete’s blossomed out in his new school.
blossom into
The idea blossomed into a successful mail order business.

definition.text: an infectious illness can be passed from one person to another, especially through the air you breathe

meaning.translation: واگیردار ، مسری

examples.text: infectious diseases
Flu is highly infectious.

definition.text: someone who is infectious has an illness and could pass it to other people

meaning.translation: دارای بیماری واگیردار

definition.text: infectious feelings or laughter spread quickly from one person to another

meaning.translation: وقتی این صفت برای احساسات یا خنده به کار می رود به معنی این است که سریع بین یک شخص و اشخاص دیگر پخش می شود

examples.text: an infectious smile
infectious enthusiasm

definition.text: a disease that affects a particular part of your body and is caused by bacteria or a virus

meaning.translation: عفونت

examples.text: The baby had an ear infection.
infection of/in
an infection of the bladder

definition.text: when someone is infected by a disease

meaning.translation: عمل سرایت کردن یک بیماری

examples.text: Always sterilize the needle to prevent infection.

definition.text: to give someone a disease

meaning.translation: مریض کردن ، سرایت دادن یک بیماری

examples.text: People with the virus may feel perfectly well, but they can still infect others.
infect with
the number of people infected with HIV

definition.text: to make something contain something harmful that gives people a disease

meaning.translation: آلوده کردن چیزی با ماده ای مضر که می تواند انسان ها را مریض کند

examples.text: be infected with something
Eggs known to be infected with salmonella were allowed to go on sale.

definition.text: if a feeling or interest that you have infects other people, it makes them begin to feel the same way or have the same interest

meaning.translation: منتقل شدن (وقتی این فعل در مورد یک احساس به کار می رود به معنی این است که بقیه افراد هم شروع می کنند به درک این احساس)

examples.text: Lucy’s enthusiasm soon infected the rest of the class.

definition.text: if a virus infects your computer or disk, it changes or destroys the information in or on it

meaning.translation: آلوده کردن کامپیوتر به یک ویروس

definition.text: to force liquid out of a container so that it comes out in a stream of very small drops and covers an area

meaning.translation: اسپری کردن ، افشاندن

examples.text: spray somebody/something with something
She sprayed herself with perfume.
spray something on/onto/over something
Someone had sprayed blue paint over his car.
Vandals had sprayed graffiti on the walls.
spray crops/plants etc(= cover them with liquid to protect them from insects or disease )
The fruit is sprayed every four weeks.

definition.text: if liquids or small bits spray somewhere, they are quickly scattered through the air

meaning.translation: اسپری شدن ، افشان شدن

examples.text: spray from
Champagne sprayed from the bottle.

definition.text: to shoot a lot of bullets towards a person or place very quickly

meaning.translation: گلوله های خیلی زیادی به سرعت به کسی یا مکانی شلیک کردن

examples.text: Gunmen sprayed the crowd with bullets.

definition.text: liquid which is forced out of a special container in a stream of very small drops

meaning.translation: مایعی که در هنگام اسپری کردن خارج می شود

examples.text: a new hair styling spray
Most farmers use pesticide sprays.

definition.text: a container which forces liquid out in a stream of small drops

meaning.translation: اسپری

examples.text: Mary took a perfume spray from her handbag.

definition.text:
a) water in very small drops that is blown from the sea etc or sent up by vehicles on a wet road
b) liquid that comes quickly from somewhere in very small drops

meaning.translation: قطره های خیلی ریزی از آب یا سایر مایعات

examples.text: spray from the waves
My face was stinging from the salt spray.
spray of
A spray of blood came from his mouth.

definition.text: a small branch or stem with leaves or flowers on it, used for decoration

meaning.translation: یک شاخه یا ساقه کوچک با برگ ها و گل هایی روی آن که برای تزیین به کار می رود

examples.text: spray of
a spray of holly

definition.text: an attractive arrangement of flowers or leaves

meaning.translation: یک چینش جذاب از گل ها یا برگ ها

examples.text: spray of
a spray of violets and primroses

definition.text: a lot of bullets or very small objects moving quickly through the air

meaning.translation: تعداد خیلی زیادی گلوله یا اشیاء خیلی کوچک که به سرعت در هوا حرکت می کنند

definition.text: to spray small amounts of a liquid on something

meaning.translation: اسپری کردن

definition.text: an extreme unhealthy interest in something or worry about something, which stops you from thinking about anything else

meaning.translation: وسواس

examples.text: Gambling became an obsession, and he eventually lost everything.
obsession with
an unhealthy obsession with being thin
The current obsession with exam results is actually harming children’s education.
The game pachinko became a national obsession .
He has an enthusiasm for art, to the point of obsession in my opinion.
She looked after him with a devotion bordering on obsession .

definition.text: the exact opposite of what has just been mentioned

meaning.translation: بر عکس ، خلاف چیزی که گفته شده

examples.text: quite/just/precisely/exactly the reverse
I didn’t mean to insult her – quite the reverse (= in fact, I meant to praise her ).
I owe you nothing. If anything, the reverse is true (= you owe me ).

definition.text: in the opposite way to normal or to the previous situation

meaning.translation: بر عکس

examples.text: US video recorders cannot play European tapes, and the same applies in reverse.

definition.lexUnit: go into reverse/put something into reverse
definition.text: to start to happen or to make something happen in the opposite way

meaning.translation: اتفاق افتادن چیزی در جهت عکس

examples.text: The incident threatened to put the peace process into reverse.

definition.text: the position of the gears in a vehicle that makes it go backwards

meaning.translation: دنده عقب

examples.text: into/in reverse
Put the car into reverse.

definition.text: a defeat or a problem that delays your plans

meaning.translation: یک شکست یا مشکل که برنامه های تو را به تعویق می اندازد

examples.text: Losing the Senate vote was a serious reverse for the president.

definition.text: the less important side or the back of an object that has two sides

meaning.translation: سمتی از چیزی که کمتر اهمیت دارد یا پشت چیزی که دو سمت دارد

examples.text: on the reverse
The British ten-pence coin has a lion on the reverse.

definition.text: to change something, such as a decision, judgment, or process so that it is the opposite of what it was before

meaning.translation: برعکس کردن

examples.text: reverse a decision/verdict/policy etc
The decision was reversed on appeal.
reverse a trend/process/decline etc
More changes are required to reverse the trend towards centralised power.

definition.text: if a vehicle or its driver reverses, they go backwards

meaning.translation: دنده عقب رفتن

examples.text: reverse out of/into etc
Bob reversed into a parking space.
reverse something into/out of something
I reversed the car into a side road.

definition.text: to change around the usual order of the parts of something, or the usual things two people do

meaning.translation: تغییر دادن ، برعکس کردن

examples.text: reverse roles/positions
Our roles as child and guardian had now been reversed.

definition.text: to turn something over or around, in order to show the back of it

meaning.translation: برعکس کردن ، وارونه کردن

examples.text: Reverse the paper in the printer.

definition.text: to change your opinion or position in an argument

meaning.translation: تغییر دادن عقیده یا موضع در یک بحث

examples.text: Suddenly, he reversed himself completely.

definition.text: to make a telephone call which is paid for by the person you are telephoning
the opposite order etc to what is usual or to what has just been stated

meaning.translation: برعکس

examples.text: The results were read out in reverse order (= with the worst first and the best last ).

definition.text: the back of something

meaning.translation: پشت چیزی

f2n.heading: Register
f2n.explanation: In everyday English, people often say that it is someone’s go in a game rather than turn :

definition.text: the time when it is your chance, duty, or right to do something that each person in a group is doing one after the other

meaning.translation: نوبت

examples.text: turn to do something
Whose turn is it to set the table?
It’s your turn . Roll the dice.
I think it’s our turn to drive the kids to school this week.

definition.text: if two or more people take turns doing work, using something etc, they do it one after the other, for example in order to share the work or play fairly

meaning.translation: به نوبت کاری را انجام دادن

examples.text: You’ll have to take turns on the swing.
take turns doing something
The students were taking turns reading aloud.
take turns in doing something
We took turns in pushing the bike along.
take turns to do something
Dan and I usually take turns to cook.

definition.text:
a)as a result of something
b)one after the other, especially in a particular order

meaning.translation: آ) در نتیجه ب) یکی پس از دیگری ، به نوبت

examples.text: Interest rates were cut and, in turn, share prices rose.
Each of us in turn had to describe how alcohol had affected our lives.

definition.text:
a) a place where one road goes in a different direction from the one you are on
b) a curve in a road, path etc

meaning.translation: پیچ (جاده یا مسیر)

examples.text: According to the map we missed our turn back there.
take the first/a wrong etc turn(= go along the first etc road )
I think we took a wrong turn coming out of town.
Take the second turn on the left.
There’s a sharp turn coming up ahead.

definition.text: a change in the direction you are moving

meaning.translation: عمل پیچیدن (تغییر جهت دادن)

examples.text: make a left/right turn
Make a left turn at the station.

definition.text: a sudden or unexpected change that makes a situation develop in a different way

meaning.translation: یک تغییر ناگهانی یا غیرمنتظره (که باعث میشه یک موقعیت به مسیر دیگه ای بره)

examples.text: take a dramatic/fresh/different etc turn
From then on, our fortunes took a downward turn.
My career had already taken a new turn.
The president was stunned by the sudden turn of events.
take a turn for the worse/better
Two days after the operation, Dad took a turn for the worse.

definition.text: the beginning of a new century or year

meaning.translation: آغاز یک قرن یا سال جدید

examples.text: the short period from the turn of the century until World War One

definition.text: happening again and again, especially in an annoying way

meaning.translation: مکرراً اتفاق افتادن (به ویژه به صورتی آزاردهنده)

examples.text: problems that presented themselves at every turn

definition.text: the act of turning something completely around a fixed point

meaning.translation: عمل چرخاندن چیزی

examples.text: I gave the screw another two or three turns.

definition.text: changing from one quality, feeling etc to another

examples.text: By turns, a 14 year old is affectionate then aggressive, silent then outspoken.

definition.text:
a)the ability to say things in a clever or funny way
b)a particular way of saying something

meaning.translation: آ) توانایی گفتن چیزها به طرزی هوشمندانه یا بامزه ب) طرز خاص گفتن چیزی

examples.text: Kate has a colourful turn of phrase.
What a strange turn of phrase!

definition.text: to say something you should not say in a particular situation, especially because you do not have enough authority to say it

meaning.translation: گفتن چیزی که نباید در یک موقعیت خاص بیانش می کردی (به ویژه بخاطر اینکه در مقامی نیستی که در مورد اون موضوع صحبت کنی)

examples.text: I’m sorry if I spoke out of turn, Major Karr.

definition.text: to do something that is helpful or unhelpful for someone

meaning.translation: انجام کاری خوب/بد برای کسی

examples.text: You did me a good turn by driving Max home last night.

definition.text: used to say that if someone does something nice for you, you should do something nice for them

meaning.translation: اگر کسی کار خوبی برای تو انجام داد ، تو هم باید کار خوبی برای او انجام بدی

definition.text: the particular way that someone usually thinks or feels

meaning.translation: ذهنیت

examples.text: an academic/practical etc turn of mind
youngsters with an independent turn of mind

definition.text:
a)if the tide is on the turn, the sea is starting to come in or go out
b)starting to change, or in the process of changing
c)if milk, fish, or other food is on the turn, it is no longer fresh

meaning.translation: آ) جزر یا مد دریا ب) در حال تغییر ج) غذای مونده (به معنی: تازه نیست)

examples.text: Hopefully my luck was on the turn.

definition.text: a sudden increase in your speed, or the ability to increase your speed suddenly

meaning.translation: افزایش ناگهانی سرعت یا توانایی انجام این کار

examples.text: He’s a top goalkicker with a surprising turn of speed.

definition.text: to be perfectly cooked

meaning.translation: کاملاً پخته شده

definition.lexUnit: take a turn in/on etc something
definition.text: to walk somewhere for pleasure

meaning.translation: دور زدن ، پیاده روی کردن در جایی برای لذت بردن

definition.text: to frighten someone

meaning.translation: ترساندن

definition.text: to feel slightly ill

meaning.translation: یه خرده احساس بیماری کردن

definition.text: to move your body so that you are looking in a different direction

meaning.translation: چرخیدن

examples.text: Ricky turned and walked away.
She turned her head in surprise.
turn around/round/away
Dan turned away, hiding the fear in his eyes.
turn (your head/face) to do something
He turned around to look at Kim.
‘No, ’ she said, turning her head to see David’s reaction.
Brigitte glared at him, turned on her heel (= turned away suddenly because of anger ), and stomped out of the room.

definition.text: to move something so that it is pointing or aiming in a different direction

meaning.translation: چرخاندن

examples.text: turn something around/over/upside down etc
You may turn over your exam papers now.
turn something on something/somebody
The firemen turned their hoses on the blaze.
turn something to face something/somebody
Could you turn your chairs to face this way ?
turn a/the page(= move a page in a book over so that you can read the next page )
turn something down/up
He turned down the corner of the sheet to peep at the baby.

definition.text:
a) to go in a new direction when you are walking, driving etc, or to make the vehicle you are using do this
b) if a road, river etc turns, it curves and starts to go in a new direction

meaning.translation: چرخیدن

examples.text: I watched until he turned the corner .
turn left/right
Turn left at the church.
turn into/onto/down etc
She cycled up the street and turned into Long Road.
Turning the car around, we headed home.
Further on, the river turns east.
The road turns sharply at the top of the hill.

definition.text: to move around a central or fixed point, or to make something move in this way

meaning.translation: چرخیدن/چرخاندن

examples.text: The wheels turned slowly, then picked up speed.
For some reason, the key wouldn’t turn.
turn the handle/knob/key/tap etc
She gently turned the handle of the bedroom door.

definition.text: to start to have a different quality, or to make something do this

meaning.translation: شدن ، کردن

examples.text: turn (something) red/blue/white etc
Rose’s hair was already turning grey.
In October the leaves turn orange and yellow.
The sun had turned the sky a glowing pink.
the weather turns cold/nasty etc it turns cold/nasty etc )
Then it turned cold and started to rain.
turn nasty/mean/violent etc(= suddenly become angry, violent etc )
The police are worried that the situation could turn violent.

definition.text: to start to think about, deal with, look at etc a particular person, thing, or subject, instead of what you were thinking about etc before

meaning.translation: معطوف کردن/شدن

examples.text: turn your attention/thoughts/efforts etc to something/somebody
Many investors have turned their attention to opportunities abroad.
Phil turned his gaze towards the older man.
turn to/towards etc something
As usual, the conversation turned back to her children.
Now is the time of year when thoughts turn in the direction of summer holidays.
Next the Senator turned to education.

definition.text:
a)to refuse to help, support, or be involved with someone or something
b)to turn so that your back is pointing towards someone or something, and you are not looking at them

meaning.translation: پشت کردن (به معنی: آ) کمک نکردن ، حمایت نکردن و غیره ب) چرخیدن به نحوی که پشتت به طرف کسی باشه)

examples.text: How can you turn your back on your own mother?
In his twenties he turned his back on his Catholic faith.
Angrily, she turned her back on him.

definition.text: to become a particular age, or to reach a particular time

meaning.translation: شدن

examples.text: somebody turns 15/20/40 etc
My son’s just turned 18.
it’s turned 2 o'clock/5/midday etc
It’s just turned three.

definition.text:
a)to pull a piece of clothing, bag etc so that the inside is facing out
b)to search everywhere for something, in a way that makes a place very untidy
c)to completely change the way that something is done, organized, thought about etc

meaning.translation: آ) پشت و رو کردن ب) زیر و رو کردن (به معنی: همه جا رو به دنبال چیزی گشتن به صورتی که اون مکان رو خیلی بهم بریزی و نامرتب کنی) ج) زیر و رو کردن (به معنی: روش انجام کاری ، سازماندهی چیزی ، تفکر در مورد چیزی و غیره را به کلی تغییر دادن)

examples.text: Turn the sweater inside out before you wash it.
Thieves had turned the house upside down.
New approaches to marketing turn old practices upside down.
Her opinion of him had been turned on its head.

definition.text: to start to improve after going through a difficult period or experience

meaning.translation: بهتر شدن اوضاع بعد از یک دوره یا تجربه سخت

examples.text: The manager of the hotel chain claims that they have turned the corner.

definition.text: to make or let someone or something go out from where they are

examples.text: turn somebody/something out/outside/into etc (something)
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured board.
There are some criminals who cannot be turned loose onto the streets.

definition.text: if the tide turns, the sea starts to come in or go out again

meaning.translation: اتفاق افتادن جزر یا مد دریا

definition.text: if something such as a war, situation, game of sport etc turns, or someone turns it, something happens to change the way it is developing

meaning.translation: تغییر کردن/دادن وضعیت چیزی

examples.text: Mills turned the game by scoring twice.
The victory turned the tide of the war in North Africa.

definition.text: to be disloyal to a person, group, or idea that you have strongly supported before
to twist your ankle in a way that injures it

meaning.translation: پیچیدن قوزک پا به صورتی که بهش آسیب بزنه

examples.text: Wright turned his ankle in the first minutes of the game.

definition.lexUnit: an actor turned politician/a housewife turned author etc
definition.text: someone who has done one job and then does something completely different

meaning.translation: شدن

definition.text: to be attractive in a romantic or sexual way

examples.text: She turned heads whenever she walked into a room.

definition.text: if something turns people’s heads, they are surprised by it

meaning.translation: متعجب کردن ، شگفت زده کردن

examples.text: It did turn some heads when he moved back to the village.

definition.text: to make a profit

meaning.translation: سود کردن

definition.text: to say something in a particular way

meaning.translation: چیزی را به نحو خاصی گفتن

examples.text: Cohen knows how to turn a phrase in his lyrics.

definition.text: to break up soil so that it is ready for growing crops

meaning.translation: شخم زدن زمین برای اینکه آماده پرورش محصول بشه

examples.text: a distant tractor turning the soil

definition.text: to shape a wooden or metal object using a special tool

meaning.translation: شکل دادن

definition.text: if milk turns, it becomes sour

meaning.translation: ترش شدن شیر

definition.text: the legal ending of a marriage

meaning.translation: طلاق

examples.text: Why doesn’t she get a divorce ?
One in three marriages ends in divorce.
file/sue/petition for divorce(= start the legal divorce process )
His wife has started divorce proceedings.
the rise in the divorce rate
She received the house as part of the divorce settlement  (= the amount of money, property etc each person receives in a divorce case ).
The Act extended the grounds  (= legal reasons ) for divorce.

definition.text: the fact of separating two related things

meaning.translation: تفکیک ، جدایی

examples.text: divorce between
the divorce between theory and method

definition.text: if someone divorces their husband or wife, or if two people divorce, they legally end their marriage

meaning.translation: طلاق گرفتن

examples.text: David’s parents divorced when he was six.
My father threatened to divorce her.

definition.text: to separate two ideas, subjects etc completely

meaning.translation: تفکیک کردن

examples.text: divorce something from something
It is difficult to divorce sport from politics.

definition.text: to stop being involved in an activity, organization, situation etc

meaning.translation: جدا کردن

examples.text: divorce yourself from something
Our society has divorced itself from religion.

definition.text: fruit baked inside a pastry covering

meaning.translation: شیرینی پای (نوعی شیرینی میوه ای)

examples.text: slice/piece of pie
Would you like another piece of apple pie?

definition.text: meat or vegetables baked inside a pastry or potato covering

examples.text: I had steak and kidney pie with chips.

definition.text: a share of something such as money, profits etc

meaning.translation: سهمی از چیزی مانند پول ، سود و غیره

examples.text: The smaller companies want a bigger share of the pie.

definition.text: something good that someone says will happen, but which you think is impossible or unlikely

examples.text: Hope of a cure is just pie in the sky.

definition.text: a very large orange fruit that grows on the ground, or the inside of this fruit

meaning.translation: کدو تنبل ، کدو حلوایی

examples.text: a very large orange fruit that grows on the ground, or the inside of this fruit
